results.title: Calcutta
results.brief_description: Calcutta is one of India’s largest cities. Paul Cox’s camera explores the lives of the poorest of its inhabitants. Filled with the vibrant sounds of Indian music, the culture of the people of Calcutta is rich and vital despite the harsh conditions in which they live.

results.title: Mastering change: management and leadership skills for turbulent times
results.creator_credit: Matthew A Keller, Stephen Sealy and CareerTrack Publications
results.brief_description: Designed to assist managers in the implementation of change and to ensure that employees deal with change effectively. Part 1 examines management and leadership issues and understanding the processes involved in organisational change. Part 2 looks at planning for change rather than allowing it to happen suddenly. Part 3 presents the “4 C’s” involved in managing the implementation of change. Part 4 highlights the issues involved in leading a team into the future. A handbook accompanies the series with exercises to reinforce relevant points.

results.title: Mastering change: managing your future in an age of uncertainty
results.creator_credit: Matthew A Keller, Stephen Sealy and CareerTrack Publications
results.brief_description: Designed to develop skills which will enable employees to cope with change and managers to introduce change with positive effects. Part 1 looks at understanding change. Part 2 presents keys to becoming change skilled, to become a victor rather than a victim of change. Part 3 gives six steps to responding to organisational change while Part 4 examines the development of future tense thinking. A handbook accompanies the series with exercises to reinforce relevant points.

results.title: Proofreading & editing skills: spelling and usage. Vol.3
results.brief_description: This video seminar presentation led by Debra Smith and Helen Sutton looks at spelling and usage of words in the pursuit of achieving total accuracy in written communication. Areas covered include: a fun test to see how good your spelling is; how and when to use your computer’s spellchecker; capitalisation rules; when to use numbers and when to use words (50 or fifty); 200 frequently misspelled words; frequently misused words; the most commonly confused pairs of words and a proofreading post-test to see how much you’ve learnt.

results.title: How to give exceptional customer service. Vol.4
results.brief_description: This seminar presentation with Lisa Ford looks at becoming a service star: team building, upselling and exceeding expectations. Some of the things you’ll learn include; the five key characteristics of a customer service star and how to develop them, guidelines for successful cross-selling and upselling, and how to make sure you are always increasing your level of customer service. This is perfect for top performers, veterans and high-potential newcomers. It offers dozens of exciting new ideas for doing “the same old job” better than ever. It’s a motivating “how-to” for even the most talented customer service professional.

results.title: How to interview & hire the right people. V.1
results.brief_description: In this seminar presentation with Stephen Carline, we learn that when people don’t succeed, it is rarely because they lack skills or credentials. It is usually because they don’t fit in. This program helps to find the ones who will fit. Learn powerful new ways to determine what you really need in the position by learning to write job descriptions that help you define excactly what you are seeking. Discover how to see past resume hype by preparing pertinent questions to get a clear picture of each candidate’s track record.

results.title: Team building: How to motivate and manage people. V.3
results.brief_description: Presented by Mark Sanborn, this seminar presentation shows how you can turn your staff into a “can do” team. Part one: “Teamwork pays off” looks at achieving desired bottom line results through teamwork, 21 questions to determine the success of your team amd seven commitments of strong team relationships. Part two: “Developing a team vision” investigates three types of goals you can set for your team, fun group “games” you can play to build you team, team players vs. team slayers, and soliciting valuable input from your team memebrs.

results.title: Team building: How to motivate and manage people. V.2
results.brief_description: Presented by Mark Sanborn, this volume includes as follows; Part one: “Team communication”investigates how the information system can dramatically increase innovation, six essential elements of a powerful team meeting and keys to handle interpersonal conflict. Part two: “Motivate and celebrate” looks at five reasons why people procrastinate, use rewards that really motivate and new ways to celebrate your team’s accomplishments that increase productivity and commitment.

results.title: Amazon to ice
results.brief_description: Explore the wonderous waterways of South America from the infamous Tierra del Fuego to the raging rapids of the Upper Amazon; an area studded with relics from the ancient Inca past. A truly breathtaking journey includes the Moreno Glacier, the face of the Iguazu Falls and a visit to the inhabitants of the Islands in Lake Titicaca.

results.title: The Student prince
results.creator_credit: Richard Thorpe, Joe Pasternak and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Edmund Purdom and Ann Bltyh star in this romantic musical set to the music of Sigmund Romberg. Prince Karl is in love, but not with the princess he is supposed to wed in a state-arranged marriage. The object of his affections is a mere Heildberg barmaid. Mario Lanza provided the singing for the film.
